001package io.github.ai4ci.abm;
002
003import java.io.Serializable;
004
005import org.immutables.value.Value;
006
007import io.github.ai4ci.flow.mechanics.State;
008import io.github.ai4ci.flow.mechanics.State.PolicyState;
009import io.github.ai4ci.functions.DelayDistribution;
010
011/**
012 * Simulation wide parameters that do not change over the course of the
013 * simulation. Many of these are calibrated from the initial configuration of
014 * the model.
015 *
016 * @see io.github.ai4ci.abm.Calibration
017 */
018@Value.Immutable
019public interface OutbreakBaseline extends Serializable {
020
021        // Simulation baseline viral factors
022
023        /**
024         * All translation of viral load to transmission probability happens through
025         * this method, including threshold behaviour. The parameter is calibrated to
026         * match simulation R0 given the network topology by
027         * {@link Calibration#inferViralLoadTransmissionParameter(Outbreak, double)}.
028         *
029         * The function that links viral load to transmission is:
030         *
031         * <pre>
032         * P(transmission) = 1 - exp(-k * (v - 1))
033         * </pre>
034         *
035         * Behaviour: returns 0 for viral loads less than 1 (below threshold),
036         * otherwise applies the exponential mapping.
037         *
038         * @param viralLoad the viral load value (unitless)
039         * @param parameter the calibrated scale parameter (k)
040         * @return probability in [0,1] of transmission on a single contact
041         */
042        static double transmissibilityFromViralLoad(
043                        double viralLoad, double parameter
044        ) {
045                if (viralLoad < 1) { return 0D; }
046                return 1 - Math.exp(-parameter * (viralLoad - 1));
047        }
048
049        /**
050         * The default policy state applied to agents at simulation start. This
051         * encodes baseline non-pharmaceutical interventions such as masking, social
052         * distancing or closures that are present for the outbreak baseline.
053         *
054         * @return the default {@link PolicyState} for agents at simulation start
055         */
056        State.PolicyState getDefaultPolicyState();
057
058        /**
059         * Used in calibration of risk models, to help determine the information
060         * value of a contact's risk.
061         *
062         * @return the expected number of contacts per person per day in the baseline
063         *         contact network, calibrated from the initial configuration of the
064         *         model (e.g. network topology and contact rates).
065         *
066         */
067        double getExpectedContactsPerPersonPerDay();
068
069        /**
070         * Calibrated from the 95% quantile of the infectivity profile of the in host
071         * model run over a set of unadjusted parameters
072         *
073         * @return the infective duration in model time units (e.g. days) derived
074         *         from the infectivity profile, used as the default duration of
075         *         infectiousness in the simulation and for calibration of risk
076         *         models that rely on a fixed infectious duration. Note that the
077         *         actual duration of infectiousness for a given person in the
078         *         simulation may be shorter or longer than this value, depending on
079         *         their viral load trajectory and the infectiousness cutoff used to
080         *         determine when they are considered infectious.
081         *
082         */
083        @Value.Derived
084        default int getInfectiveDuration() {
085                return (int) this.getInfectivityProfile().size();
086        }
087
088        /**
089         * The infectivity profile is a time-varying distribution (indexed by days
090         * since infection) that describes relative infectiousness. It is used to
091         * compute time-dependent infectivity and to derive infective duration.
092         *
093         * @return the {@link DelayDistribution} representing the infectivity profile
094         */
095        DelayDistribution getInfectivityProfile();
096
097        /**
098         * Calibrated from the infection case ratio and the case fatality rate this
099         * gives a simulation wide cutoff that the average person will experience
100         * symptoms bad enough to die.
101         *
102         * @return severity value threshold for death
103         */
104        double getSeverityDeathCutoff();
105
106        /**
107         * Calibrated from the infection case ratio and the case hospitalisation rate
108         * this gives a simulation wide cutoff that the average person will
109         * experience symptoms bad enough to require hospitalisation.
110         *
111         * @return severity value threshold for hospitalisation
112         */
113        double getSeverityHospitalisationCutoff();
114
115        /**
116         * Calibrated from the infection case ratio this gives a simulation wide
117         * cutoff that the average person will experience symptoms. Obtained from the
118         * running the in host model over a set of samples.
119         *
120         * @return severity value threshold for symptomatic infections
121         */
122        double getSeveritySymptomsCutoff();
123
124        /**
125         * Calibrated from the 95% quantile of the severity profile of the in host
126         * model run over a set of unadjusted parameters
127         *
128         * @return the symptom duration in model time units (e.g. days) derived from
129         *         the severity profile, used as the default duration of symptoms in
130         *         the simulation and for calibration of risk models that rely on a
131         *         fixed symptom duration. Note that the actual duration of symptoms
132         *         for a given person in the simulation may be shorter or longer than
133         *         this value, depending on their viral load trajectory and the
134         *         severity cutoff used to determine when they are considered
135         *         symptomatic.
136         *
137         */
138        int getSymptomDuration();
139
140        /**
141         * This is the per contact network edge baseline probability of transmission
142         * (e.g. T in Koch et al 2013 Edge removal in random contact networks).
143         *
144         * The baseline probability of transmission to someone else given an
145         * infectious contact is calibrated via R0, given a default contact rate but
146         * depoends on the viral load from the in host model. It is modified by
147         * exogenous day to day factors such as seasonality at an individual level in
148         * {@link PersonState#getAdjustedTransmissibility()}, which accounts for
149         * factors such as individual personal variation of susceptibility to
150         * infection (e.g. medications, such as PreP) and individual day to day
151         * variation of transmission due to things such as mask wearing.
152         *
153         * @param viralLoad the (unitless) viral load value from the in-host model
154         * @return baseline per-contact transmission probability for the given viral
155         *         load
156         */
157        default Double getTransmissibilityBaseline(double viralLoad) {
158                return transmissibilityFromViralLoad(
159                                viralLoad, this.getViralLoadTransmissibilityParameter()
160                );
161        }
162
163        /**
164         * This value is a scale factor for the viral load to make a probability that
165         * a transmission will occur given a particular viral load. This is
166         * calibrated using the viral load profile and an overall probability of per
167         * edge transmission.
168         * {@link Calibration#inferViralLoadTransmissionParameter(Outbreak, double)}
169         *
170         * @return the calibrated transmissibility scale parameter (k) applied to
171         *         viral load
172         */
173        double getViralLoadTransmissibilityParameter();
174
175}
